updated_cases.title: Verify NAS handles validity is set with non-int value ("30")
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify NAS handles where users attempt to set a validity period with non-int value ("30"), and provides appropriate error messages then set to default value.
updated_cases.custom_steps:
Set the ECA validity to "30".
Verify how NAS responds and the error message displayed.
updated_cases.custom_expected:
- NAS detects the invalid ECA validity setting.
- NAS provides a meaningful error message indicating that the validity period must be between 7 and 45 days.
- NAS set the value to default value

updated_cases.title: Verify NAS validity check is auto trigger and renew the certificate according to the configuration
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify NAS validity check is auto trigger and renew the certificate according to the configuration
updated_cases.custom_steps:
Set the NAS validity check setting eca_auto_renew_day to 50
Set the NAS validity check setting eca_auto_renew_day to 3m
Verify that NAS check every tenant ECA validity has more than 50 days before expired.
Verify that NAS check every tenant ECA validity every 3m.
updated_cases.custom_expected:
- All tenant ECA have more than 50 days before expire will be renew.
- NAS do validity check every 3m

updated_cases.title: Verify case-insensitive-url could be enable by feature flag
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify case-insensitive-url could be enable by feature flag
updated_cases.custom_preconds: The feature flag for case-insensitive-url - enabled is initially "false"
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Set the feature flag "true" by cfgpuasher
2. Check nsproxy load the config file
3. Check if nsproxy treat url case-sensitive
updated_cases.custom_expected:
- nsproxy successfully detects the feature flag change.
- nsproxy should treat url in url list case-sensitive

updated_cases.title: Verify case-insensitive-url could be disable by feature flag
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify case-insensitive-url could be disable by feature flag
updated_cases.custom_preconds: The feature flag for case-insensitive-url - enabled is initially "true"
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Set the feature flag "false" by cfgpuasher
2. Check nsproxy load the config file
3. Check if nsproxy treat url case-insensitive
updated_cases.custom_expected:
- nsproxy successfully detects the feature flag change.
- nsproxy should treat url in url list case-insensitive

updated_cases.title: Verify NSProxy match case-insensitive url with RTP policy
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify NSProxy match case-insensitive url with RTP policy
updated_cases.custom_preconds:
1. case-insensitive-url is enabled.
2. Configured custom url lists and custom categories with url
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Create RTP policy that block user of accessing url in custom category
2. User try to access the url with different case
updated_cases.custom_expected: NSProxy should match all variations of case in the paths against the custom URL list and allow/deny access accordingly to the policy.

updated_cases.title: Verify "WWW.EXAMPLE.COM/EXAMPLEPATH" matched the url list of "www.example.com/examplepath"
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify "WWW.EXAMPLE.COM/EXAMPLEPATH" matched the url list of "www.example.com/examplepath"
updated_cases.custom_preconds:
1. case-insensitive-url is enabled
2. Configured custom url lists and custom categories with url
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Configure a custom url list.
2. Send url lookup requests of the url.
updated_cases.custom_expected: NSProxy should match all variations of case in the domain against the custom URL list.

updated_cases.title: Verify "example.com/examplepath" matched the url list of "EXAMPLE.COM/EXAMPLEPATH"
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify "example.com/examplepath" matched the url list of "EXAMPLE.COM/EXAMPLEPATH"
updated_cases.custom_preconds:
1. case-insensitive-url is enabled
2. Configured custom url lists and custom categories with url
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Configure a custom url list.
2. Send url lookup requests of the url.
updated_cases.custom_expected: NSProxy should match all variations of case in the domain against the custom URL list.

updated_cases.title: Verify "www.example.com/examplepath" matched the url list of "www.EXAMPLE.com/EXAMPLEPATH"
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify "www.example.com/examplepath" matched the url list of "www.EXAMPLE.com/EXAMPLEPATH"
updated_cases.custom_preconds:
1. case-insensitive-url is enabled
2. Custom URL list configured with domains containing mixed case characters.
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Configure a custom URL list with domains containing mixed case characters.
2. Send url lookup requests with URLs containing domains with a different mix of upper and lower case characters.
updated_cases.custom_expected: NSProxy should correctly handle URLs with mixed case domain parts according to the configured case sensitivity setting for domain matching.

updated_cases.title: Verify "WWW.example.COM/ExamplePath" matched the url list of "www.EXAMPLE.com/examplepath"
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify "WWW.example.COM/ExamplePath" matched the url list of "www.EXAMPLE.com/examplepath"
